page.title: 05BRITFORD VILLAGE , SALISBURY
page.content: In Britford is a canal which was a 17th c. attempt to bypass unnavigable stretches of the river Avon.It once had a lock on it. The gates have now disappeared leaving only the stonework on either side of the lock. The canal fell out of use in the 18th c. The lock was later converted to a weir which still stands. The village is partly water-meadow & the land is mostly farm land. There are a few streams in the village & there are quite a few big houses & also council houses. Unusually there is no shop,but there is a church & school. There are four main areas of housing & farms.
